text: Any idea why is the plastic recycling rate so low in SG? 😔 So even if we painstakingly clean out our plastic bottles for recycling, they likely end up in the landfill..

answers.text: @xinmintan it’s really disappointing isn’t it. The key issues we believe are 1. Most people still don’t bother to recycle. The recent recycling vending machines probably caused a spike but it’s still not an internalized habit here. 2. Most of our recycling items in the blue bin are contaminated cos some treat them like the rubbish chute. In these cases, all the hard work by people cleaning out their plastics goes down the drain. Hence many eco warriors keep their recyclable for the monthly Tzu Chi collection. 3. A great worldwide issue is there’s not enough demand for recycled plastics. Recycling is a complex and expensive activity and without sufficient demand and profit, no organization will be incentivized to do it. So ultimately, whether it is plastic or glass or paper, the best way out is to reduce. Don’t stop recycling but if we can reduce it’s the best option.

text: Hi friend, do you know that 1/3 of the world's food is wasted, which creates 3.3 billion tons of greenhouse gases? We are rescuing food waste and giving it a new life. Would you like to join us?
I will be open to try for environmental reason

answers.text: @underthemoonlight.sg yay!! Every effort adds up!! And ripples out!! 💪😋🧡🙏
